title: Hypotheses
text: What are the Null Hypothesis $$H_0$$ and Alternative Hypothesis in this context?

hintAnswer: $$H_0$$: The local results follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee population
title: Null Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_0$$: The local results follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee population
$$H_0$$: The local results do not follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee population

hintAnswer: $$H_a$$: The local results do not follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee population
title: Alternative Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_a$$: The local results follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee population
$$H_a$$: The local results do not follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee population

title: Consider what distribution is most appropriate to use in this problem.
What is the degree of freedom?
Compute the p-value.
text: Round the answer to four decimal places.

title: Compare with the significant level 0.05.
text: At 5% significance level, \alpha $$=$$ 0.05. For this data, P < \alpha. Reject the null hypothesis.

title: Interpret the Result
text: At the 5% level of significance, from the data, there is insufficient evidence to conclude that local data do not follow the distribution of the U.S. AP examinee distribution.
